title: Cedar Point
summary: Cedar Point is a 364-acre (147 ha) amusement park located on a Lake Erie peninsula in Sandusky, Ohio, United States. Opened in 1870, it is considered the second-oldest operating amusement park in the US behind only Lake Compounce.[2] Cedar Point is owned and operated by Cedar Fair and is the flagship of the amusement park chain.[3] Known as "America's Roller Coast",[4] the park features 16 roller coasters – third-most in the world behind Canada's Wonderland (17), Energylandia (17), and Six Flags Magic Mountain (19). Its newest roller coaster, Steel Vengeance, opened to the public on May 5, 2018.[5]
